sources.title: Dungeon Of Harrow
sources.description: A man is shipwrecked on the island of a cruel count and taken prisoner. This film was written and directed by comic book artist Pat Boyette.

sources.title: Dungeon of Harrow (1964) PSYCHOTRONIC
sources.description:
It's FRIGHT NIGHT @PizzaFLIX 
Writer/Director: Pat Boyette
Stars: Russ Harvey, Helen Hogan, William McNulty

When a shipwreck survivor washes ashore at the banks of a waterfront castle, he is held captive by a sadistic count and his insane family members!

TRIVIA: Featured in the very first issue of Psychotronic Video, the American film magazine founded in 1980. Publisher/editor Michael J. Weldon championed what he dubbed "psychotronic movies," defined as "the ones traditionally ignored or ridiculed by mainstream critics at the time of their release: horror, exploitation, action, science fiction, and movies that used to play in drive-ins or inner-city grindhouses."

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

sources.title: The Dungeon of Harrow (1962)
sources.description: A man is shipwrecked on the island of a cruel Count and taken prisoner. Watch on RetroFlix:  https://retroflix.org/the-dungeon-of-harrow-1962/

sources.title: The Dungeon Of Harrow (1962) Horror
sources.description: Two castaways (Russ Harvey) find themselves at the mercy of a demented count (William McNulty) and his leprous wife.

metadata.Plot: An evil, sadistic count lives in a waterfront castle with his insane family members. One day the survivor of a shipwreck washes ashore near the castle and finds himself a captive there.
metadata.Actors: Russ Harvey, Helen Hogan, William McNulty
